id: API Management, Role Based Access Controldlaoz
shape: API Management, Role Based Access Control

blueprint.description: Responsible for authentication, authorization, and identity management, ensuring secure access control with SSO, MFA, and OAuth/OpenID Connect. Possible technologies include open-source solutions like Keycloak, Authelia, ORY Hydra/Kratos; enterprise IAM platforms like Okta, Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD), Google Cloud Identity, AWS Cognito; API gateway/service mesh-based IAM like Kong with OIDC Plugin, Istio with SPIFFE; federated identity providers like Auth0, Ping Identity, OneLogin; and self-hosted solutions like Dex, FusionAuth. The selection depends on factors like scalability, compliance, integration needs, and security policies.

The Breeze Workflow Engine orchestrates business processes across microservices and external integrations, enabling automation, state management, event-driven execution, and observability. It supports technologies like Camunda, Apache Airflow, Temporal.io, Netflix Conductor, Zeebe, JBPM, Argo Workflows, and custom implementations using Spring State Machine, AWS Step Functions, or Azure Logic Apps.

The Breeze Notification Engine manages multi-channel communication, enabling email, SMS, push notifications, IVR, and in-app alerts with configurable templates and event-driven triggers. It supports technologies like Amazon SES, Twilio, SendGrid, Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), OneSignal, WebSockets, Exotel, and custom implementations using Kafka or RabbitMQ for message dispatching.

Powers intelligent interactions through chatbots and voice assistants, leveraging GenAI for contextual understanding and dynamic responses. Supports tools like Dialogflow, Rasa, Microsoft Bot Framework for rule-based and NLP-driven bots, and advanced LLM-based solutions using OpenAI, Anthropic, or RAG architectures with vector databases like Pinecone, Weaviate, and GraphDB.

Enables dynamic form creation, validation, and data capture with support for custom workflows and integrations. Modern implementations leverage tools like Form.io, Camunda Forms, React JSON Schema Form, and enterprise solutions like Microsoft PowerApps or OpenForms, with AI-assisted form generation and autofill capabilities using GenAI and NLP models.

The Breeze Search Engine provides efficient indexing and retrieval of structured and unstructured data, enabling fast and scalable search capabilities across the platform. It can leverage technologies like Elasticsearch, Apache Solr, OpenSearch, or PostgreSQL full-text search, depending on the use case and scalability requirements.

The Breeze Polyglot Engine enables seamless development and execution of services in multiple programming languages within the same ecosystem, supporting interoperability and scalability. It can leverage technologies like GraalVM, gRPC, Apache Thrift, Docker (for language-specific containers), Kubernetes, and service mesh solutions like Istio or Linkerd to facilitate cross-language communication.

Provides machine learning model training, deployment, and inference capabilities for predictive analytics, automation, and intelligent decision-making. It leverages frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, and cloud AI services such as AWS SageMaker, Google Vertex AI, and Azure Machine Learning.

A scalable storage layer that ingests, processes, and manages raw and structured data from various sources. It supports batch and stream processing using technologies like Apache Hadoop, Amazon S3, Delta Lake, and NoSQL databases, ensuring efficient data persistence and retrieval.

Enables real-time and batch data processing for insights, reporting, and business intelligence. It includes tools like Apache Spark, Apache Flink, Snowflake, and BI platforms such as Tableau, Power BI, and Looker, integrating with AI-driven analytics for enhanced decision-making.

Event-Driven Architecture (EDA) in Breeze enables asynchronous communication between microservices through events, ensuring scalability, decoupling, and real-time data processing. It utilizes technologies like Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ, NATS, Pulsar, and AWS EventBridge for event streaming, message brokering, and event processing.

blueprint.name: Applicant Service
blueprint.description: Handles applicant registration, document submission, and status updates.

scenarios.scenario: Applicant starts registration with mobile number verification
scenarios.description: The applicant initiates the registration process by verifying their mobile number and proceeds to enter personal and professional details.

scenarios.scenario: Applicant completes registration by submitting all required documents
scenarios.description: The applicant submits personal, educational, employment, and medical details to complete the registration process.

scenarios.scenario: Applicant submits the registration form after filling all details
scenarios.description: The applicant fills in all required fields and submits the registration form for verification.

scenarios.scenario: Applicant makes changes to the registration form as required
scenarios.description: The applicant updates the registration form based on feedback from previous employers or verification checks.

actions.action: Log in to the application portal

scenarios.scenario: Applicant checks the status of their application online
scenarios.description: The applicant logs into the portal to view the current status of their application, including any flags or required actions.

scenarios.scenario: Applicant receives notifications about application status changes
scenarios.description: The applicant receives email or SMS notifications regarding changes in the status of their application.

actions.action: Log in to the application portal

scenarios.scenario: Applicant re-applies after a 30-day waiting period following rejection
scenarios.description: The applicant waits for 30 days after rejection and then re-applies by updating their application with new or corrected information.

actions.action: Modify necessary details in the application

scenarios.scenario: Applicant updates application details before re-applying
scenarios.description: The applicant reviews and updates their application details to address reasons for previous rejection before re-applying.

blueprint.name: Driver Service
blueprint.description: Manages driver profiles, trip assignments, and compliance details.

scenarios.scenario: Driver logs in to view their profile details
scenarios.description: The driver accesses their profile using their registered mobile number to view personal and professional details.

actions.action: Check all sections of the profile

scenarios.scenario: Driver checks profile for accuracy and completeness
scenarios.description: The driver reviews their profile to ensure all information is accurate and up-to-date.

scenarios.scenario: Driver adds new certifications to their profile
scenarios.description: The driver updates their profile with new certifications or training programs they have completed.

actions.action: Enter updated medical or license details

scenarios.scenario: Driver updates medical or license details
scenarios.description: The driver adds or renews details related to their medical certificates or driving license in their profile.

scenarios.scenario: Driver reviews their qualification file for compliance
scenarios.description: The driver checks their qualification file to ensure all necessary documents and certifications are in place.

scenarios.scenario: Driver accesses training files for upcoming sessions
scenarios.description: The driver views their training files to prepare for upcoming training sessions or refreshers.

scenarios.scenario: Driver logs in using mobile device and OTP
scenarios.description: The driver uses a mobile device to log into the system with a one-time password for secure authentication.

scenarios.scenario: Driver accesses trip dashboard
scenarios.description: After logging in, the driver views a dashboard displaying available trips and relevant information.

scenarios.scenario: System assigns delivery trip to driver
scenarios.description: The system automatically assigns a specific delivery trip to the driver.

scenarios.scenario: Driver decides on assigned delivery job
scenarios.description: The driver has the option to accept or reject the delivery job assigned by the system.

scenarios.scenario: Driver performs vehicle inspection
scenarios.description: Before starting the trip, the driver conducts a vehicle inspection to ensure everything is in order.

scenarios.scenario: Driver begins the delivery trip
scenarios.description: Once the vehicle inspection is complete, the driver starts the delivery trip.

scenarios.scenario: Driver uses navigation tools
scenarios.description: The driver uses navigation tools to reach the delivery destination.

scenarios.scenario: Driver delivers cargo at destination
scenarios.description: Upon arrival, the driver delivers the cargo to the specified location.

scenarios.scenario: Driver uploads proof of delivery
scenarios.description: After delivery, the driver uploads a confirmation, which may include a signature or photo as proof of delivery.

scenarios.scenario: Driver completes trip documentation
scenarios.description: Finally, the driver completes a trip report, documenting the details and status of the delivery.

scenarios.scenario: Supervisor rejects an applicant due to failed verification
scenarios.description: The supervisor rejects the applicant if verification checks reveal discrepancies or non-compliance.

scenarios.scenario: Supervisor intervenes in applications flagged for discrepancies
scenarios.description: The supervisor reviews and resolves issues in applications that have been flagged for discrepancies during verification.

actions.action: Send email or notification to applicant

scenarios.scenario: Supervisor contacts applicants for additional information
scenarios.description: The supervisor reaches out to applicants to request additional information or clarification on flagged application details.

blueprint.description: A flexible API abstraction layer that enables efficient data fetching and aggregation from multiple entity microservices, reducing over-fetching and under-fetching issues. It supports technologies like Apollo Server, Hasura, GraphQL Mesh, and AWS AppSync, facilitating optimized API interactions with role-based access control and schema stitching for seamless integration.

blueprint.description: Responsible for authentication, authorization, and identity management, ensuring secure access control with SSO, MFA, and OAuth/OpenID Connect. Possible technologies include open-source solutions like Keycloak, Authelia, ORY Hydra/Kratos; enterprise IAM platforms like Okta, Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD), Google Cloud Identity, AWS Cognito; API gateway/service mesh-based IAM like Kong with OIDC Plugin, Istio with SPIFFE; federated identity providers like Auth0, Ping Identity, OneLogin; and self-hosted solutions like Dex, FusionAuth. Enables real-time observability of system performance and health using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack, and OpenTelemetry.
Provides centralized management and role-based access control using platforms like Portainer, Lens, and Kubernetes Dashboard.

Breeze Personalized UX enables dynamic user interactions across web, mobile, and chatbot interfaces, leveraging modern frontend frameworks like React, Angular, Vue, Flutter, and React Native. Chatbots now integrate advanced GenAI capabilities, using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) with vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS) and LLMs (GPT, Claude, Gemini, Llama) for intelligent, context-aware conversations, automating workflows, and enhancing user engagement.
